Description: Fragment of warp-faced plain weave, undyed linen with purple, tapestry (grouped warp threads) wool decoration; Tapestry creates a right-angle motif with notched ends and a small protrusion in the corner (23.3cmx23.3cm, W 10-11.5cm), between this and end of the cloth are two bands (c.2.2cm deep); Number of linen self-bands; Towards fringe are two semi-purple bands with groups of four and two purple picks half-hidden by linen warp; Knotless warp fringe with groups of warp threads (c.18cm long) loosely S twisted; in one corner the remains of a plait made of warp threads, adjacent to this a plain selvedge; 70cm in from selvedge and 8cm in from fringe, is a pair of crosses (even arms) roughly embroidered in red wool (crosses to be viewed from the back of the cloth), these are possible laundry marks; Warp: linen, S spun, c.24tpc; Weft: linen & wool, S spun, c.10tpc in ground and c.42 in tapestry; Edges: one plain selvedge, one fringe, other edges cut or torn; Sewing: sewn crosses in S spun, orange wool thread, ends knotted together, slits at vertical edges af the triangle motif sewn in paired S spun linen thread.
Curator's comments: Includes small bag with three fragments of textile, probably not from the main piece; Edges cut post excavation; Information from Hero Granger-Taylor.
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Rev Greville John Chester
